Hi Karl,

NetBeans has excellent support for JUnit. One of the very few fea=
tures we are missing is generating a class from the test class (but this fe=
ature is coming and you can join the NetBeans community and vote for this i=
ssue and other issues related to JUnit).
To follow Kent's approach what you=
 need to do is first create the Dollar class in the src folder as an empty =
class, and then create the test class in the test folder.
Now type the whol=
e test. NetBeans will underline in red the lines that have a problem. Go to=
 that line and press Alt+Enter, and NetBeans will present you the option to=
 create the missing part in the source class. Once you can compile the test=
 with no errors you can run it and make it fail. Then you can put your effo=
rt in filling the source class with the logic to make the test pass.
I hope=
 this is what you were looking for.
All the best,

Marcelo.
